snippet: Confidence that Mr. Trump would fade has given way to a shocked recognition that he could upend decades of assumptions about American foreign policy.
abstract: Leaders from around world are grappling with possibility that Donald J Trump's elevation to presidential nominee of Republican Party marks new era in American public opinion regarding security alliances and trade.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and JIM YARDLEY
byline.contributor: David E. Sanger reported from Washington and Seoul, South Korea, and Jim Yardley from Rome. Jane Perlez and Yufan Huang contributed reporting from Beijing, and Richard Martyn-Hemphill from Stockholm.

lead_paragraph: Confidence that Mr. Trump would fade has given way to a shocked recognition that he could upend decades of assumptions about American foreign policy.

headline.main: In Donald Trump’s Rise, Allies See New American Approach
headline.print_headline: In the Rise of Trump, Allies See a New Approach by the U.S.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
